instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138-A with short on PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message: PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS is 2 Ohms to ground. Removed R7310, R7320, and R7330. Revealed short to ground on PPVCC_S0_CPU (2 Ohms). Any hope?

threads.title: 820-00138-A with short on PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message:
2 ohm is possibly normal value for VCORE; compare with similar board.
Your problem is one of U7310/20/30 chips is burnt.
Need to change all 3 with FDMF6708N from reliable source.
FDMF3030 was also reported on the forum as tested replacement.

threads.title: 820-00138-A with short on PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message:
I get around 20 Ohms on a good board. 
What do you consider a reliable source for the FDMF6808N chips?

threads.title: 820-00138-A with short on PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message:
Then CPU is dead, stop to waste the time with this board...

BTW, I didn't mention FDMF6808N.
That is Apple proprietary chip, NEVER sold to other!
Of course, you can throw the money buying "NEW" FDMF6808N from chinese sellers...

threads.title: 820-00138-A with short on PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message: Ok, thanks. Will assume dead CPU.
